definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
Greed is the root of all evil.
pinyin: tan1 lan2 shi4 wan4 e4 zhi1 yuan2

definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

sentences.english: The greed, discrimination and vulgarism are not souls.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪，歧视和庸俗没有灵魂。

sentences.english: When you have and hold a need, harken not to others greed.
sentences.chinese: 当你有需求的时候，不要听从他人贪婪的想法。

sentences.english: A good steward is not wasteful.
sentences.chinese: 因此，好管家是不贪婪的。

sentences.english: These voracious scavengers work together to strip the carcasses of large animals.
sentences.chinese: 这些贪婪的食腐鸟类共同协作，分食大型动物的尸体。

sentences.english: The miser gloated over his gold.
sentences.chinese: 守财奴贪婪地看着他的金子。

sentences.english: Differentiating between greediness and laziness is key to fully understanding advanced regular expressions.
sentences.chinese: 理解贪婪与懒惰的区别是运用高级正则表达式的基础。

sentences.english: We saw a vulture gorging on some rotting carcase.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见一只秃鹫正在贪婪地啄食腐尸。

sentences.english: It is greed that reduced him to a prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪让他变成了阶下囚。

sentences.english: And all gazed eagerly at the little group of horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 大家都贪婪地望那一群骑马的人。

sentences.english: Covetousness is the root of all evil.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪是一切邪恶的根源。

sentences.english: for they greedily devoured what was left of the cake.
sentences.chinese: 他们贪婪地吞掉了剩下的蛋糕。

sentences.english: Out of need and greed, they find themselves caught up in something much bigger than them.
sentences.chinese: 出需要和贪婪，他们发现自己卷入了一场更大的阴谋。

sentences.english: Fear and greed expose the spaceship crew to an alien  parasite.
sentences.chinese: 恐惧和贪婪使太空船成员受到外星寄生虫的威胁。

sentences.english: His greed looked through his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼中露出了贪婪的目光。

sentences.english: The young man remarked the greedy glance which shone in the dark eyes of his neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 青年看出了从他邻居那黑眼睛里流露出的贪婪的目光。

definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to be greedy in getting money
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
bottomless pit of desire (idiom); insatiable greed/carnal cravings are never satisfied and are a main obstruction on the path to enlightenment
to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
